required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Powered Bone Marrow Aspiration and Core Biopsy System Compared to Manual Devices
clinical_study.official_title: A Trial of the Vidacare Powered Bone Marrow Aspiration and Core Biopsy Systems (OnControl by Vidacare) Compared to Traditional Manual Devices

brief_summary.textblock: This is a randomized study evaluating use of a powered bone marrow biopsy and aspiration system (OnControl by Vidacare) compared to traditional manual devices. The hypothesis is that the powered system will reduce the level of patient pain during the aspiration and core biopsy procedures and the amount of time needed to perform the procedures.

primary_outcome.measure: Subject Reported Level of Pain During Procedure
primary_outcome.description: Subjects were asked to rate the level of pain they experienced during the procedure for needle insertion, following penetration of the cortex. A 0 to 10 pain scale was used where 0=no pain and 10= worst possible pain.

secondary_outcome.measure: Time Necessary to Perform the Bone Marrow Procedure
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Day 1 needle insertion through needle removal
secondary_outcome.description: The time necessary to perform the procedure was measured as follows: Time started once the needle and skin came into contact and time stopped once the sample was collected and the needle was removed from the patient.

arm_group.description: Hollow needle with a t-shaped handle manually pushed into the bone for the purpose of bone marrow aspiration and core biopsy collection. Manual Bone Marrow Sampling Device.
Battery powered device used for insertion of a single lumen catheter into the intraosseous space of the adult iliac crest. OnControl Bone Marrow Biopsy and Aspiration System.

intervention.intervention_name: OnControl Bone Marrow Biopsy and Aspiration System
intervention.description: Battery powered device used for insertion of a single lumen catheter into the intraosseous space of the adult iliac crest for the purpose of aspiration and core biopsy collection.
Hollow needle with a t-shaped handle that is pushed into the bone for the purpose of collecting bone marrow aspiration and core biopsy samples.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Adults over the age of 18
- Patients that require core biopsy alone, or core biopsy and bone marrow aspiration
Exclusion Criteria:
- Imprisoned
- Pregnant
- Cognitively impaired
- Requiring english language translation other than Spanish
- Patients with one or more conditions precluding bone marrow core biopsy

clinical_study.keyword: Bone marrow biopsy of iliac crest

participant_flow.recruitment_details: Adult patients 18 years of age requiring bone marrow aspiration and biopsy as part of routine care were considered eligible for the study.

group.title: Manual Bone Marrow Sampling Device
group.description: hollow needle with a t-shaped handle manually pushed into the bone for the purpose of bone marrow aspiration and core biopsy collection.

group.title: OnControl Bone Marrow System
group.description: Battery powered device used for insertion of a single lumen catheter into the intraosseous space of the adult iliac crest.

group.title: Manual Bone Marrow Sampling Device
group.description: Hollow needle with a t-shaped handle manually pushed into the bone for the purpose of bone marrow aspiration and core biopsy collection.

group.title: OnControl Bone Marrow System
group.description: Battery powered device used for insertion of a single lumen catheter into the intraosseous space of the adult iliac crest.

outcome.title: Subject Reported Level of Pain During Procedure
outcome.description: Subjects were asked to rate the level of pain they experienced during the procedure for needle insertion, following penetration of the cortex. A 0 to 10 pain scale was used where 0=no pain and 10= worst possible pain.
outcome.population: as per protocol, 50 patients were enrolled in the study and randomized to the manual bone marrow sampling device or the battery powered device.

certain_agreements.pi_employee: Principal Investigators are NOT employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: The only disclosure restriction on the PI is that the sponsor can review results communications prior to public release and can embargo communications regarding trial results for a period that is less than or equal to 60 days. The sponsor cannot require changes to the communication and cannot extend the embargo.

point_of_contact.name_or_title: Senior Director of Science and Clinical
